cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande, or 235 miles E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving very slowly north-northeast, then forecast to turn north and finally west toward the middle-upper Texas coast through early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle-upper Texas coast (between Matagorda Bay and Galveston, near Port Freeport)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northeast Mexico through the entire Texas shoreline and possibly SW Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) could reach the port late Sun-Mon with a 15% overall chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible near and just north of where the center approaches, including Brazoria County shoreline and the port entrance channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement may produce 4–8 inches of rain with localized higher totals, causing freshwater flooding in low-lying facilities and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible sedimentation in the entrance channel that could restrict draft limits.
